custom_item_1.description: 6.3 Set sticky bit on world writable directories
custom_item_1.info: This check finds all the directories that are world writeable and whose sticky bit is not set
custom_item_1.name: find_world_writeable_directories

custom_item_6.description: 6.6 User home directories should be kept private
custom_item_6.name: accounts_bad_home_permissions

custom_item_7.info: This check finds all files that are 'orphaned' (i.e.: whose owner is an invalid UID or GID)
custom_item_7.name: find_orphan_files

custom_item_9.description: Verify that FreeBSD 4.X or higher is installed

custom_item_10.info: This check reports a problem if sshd_config parameter Protocol is not set and placed after Host

custom_item_11.info: This check reports a problem if sshd_config paramter allows root login

custom_item_12.info: This check fails if Banner is not set

custom_item_14.info: This check reports if SSH is enabled on system boot in rc.conf

custom_item_15.description: 1.3 Enable TCP Wrappers and a host based firewall (/etc/hosts.allow)
custom_item_15.info: This check fails if /etc/hosts.allow is not found

custom_item_16.description: 1.3 Enable TCP Wrappers and a host based firewall (inetd_enable)
custom_item_16.info: This check fails if wrappers are not turned on

custom_item_17.description: 1.3 Enable TCP Wrappers and a host based firewall (inetd_flags)
custom_item_17.info: This check fails if flags are not set

custom_item_18.description: 1.3 Enable TCP Wrappers and a host based firewall (firewall_enable)
custom_item_18.info: This check fails if a host-based firewall is not turned on

custom_item_19.description: 1.3 Enable TCP Wrappers and a host based firewall (ipfw_load)
custom_item_19.info: This check fails if a host-based firewall has not been added to /boot/loader.conf

custom_item_20.info: This check will fail if /etc/inetd.conf has enabled daemons

custom_item_21.description: 2.2 Only enable telnetd if absolutely necessary
custom_item_21.info: This checks fails if telnet is on in /etc/inetd.conf

custom_item_22.description: 2.3 Only enable ftpd if absolutely necessary
custom_item_22.info: This checks fails if FTP is on in /etc/inetd.conf

custom_item_23.description: 2.4 Only enable rlogin/rsh/rcp if absolutely necessary (shell)
custom_item_23.info: This check fails if shell is on in /etc/inetd.conf -- this allows rlogin, rsh and rcp to be in place

custom_item_24.description: 2.4 Only enable rlogin/rsh/rcp if absolutely necessary (login)
custom_item_24.info: This check fails if login is on in /etc/inetd.conf -- this allows rlogin, rsh and rcp to be in place

custom_item_25.description: 2.5 Only enable TFTP if absolutely necessary
custom_item_25.info: This checks fails if TFTP is on in /etc/inetd.conf

custom_item_26.description: 2.6 Only enable finger if absolutely necessary
custom_item_26.info: This checks fails if finger is on in /etc/inetd.conf

custom_item_27.description: 2.7 Only enable Kerberos-related daemons if absolutely necessary (kerberos5_enable)
custom_item_27.info: This checks fails if kerberos 5 is on in /etc/rc.conf

custom_item_28.description: 2.7 Only enable Kerberos-related daemons if absolutely necessary (kadmind5_server_enable)
custom_item_28.info: This checks fails if kerberos 5 is on in /etc/rc.conf

custom_item_29.description: 2.7 Only enable Kerberos-related daemons if absolutely necessary (kpasswdd_server_enable)
custom_item_29.info: This checks fails if kerberos 5 is on in /etc/rc.conf

custom_item_31.description: 3.1 Disable login prompts on serial ports (ttyd0)
custom_item_31.info: This checks if login is allowed on serial port ttyd0. It should be off to prevent users from connecting terminals to serial ports

custom_item_32.description: 3.1 Disable login prompts on serial ports (ttyd1)
custom_item_32.info: This checks if login is allowed on serial port ttyd1. It should be off to prevent users from connecting terminals to serial ports

custom_item_33.description: 3.1 Disable login prompts on serial ports (ttyd2)
custom_item_33.info: This checks if login is allowed on serial port ttyd2. It should be off to prevent users from connecting terminals to serial ports

custom_item_34.description: 3.1 Disable login prompts on serial ports (ttyd3)
custom_item_34.info: This check reports if login is allowed on serial port ttyd3. It should be off to prevent users from connecting terminals to serial ports

custom_item_35.description: 3.2 Set password on single user console
custom_item_35.info: This check will fail if a password is not set for single user console

custom_item_36.info: Check for a good umask in all rc files

custom_item_37.info: Check for a good umask in all rc files

custom_item_38.info: Check for a good umask in all rc files

custom_item_39.info: Check for a good umask in all rc files

custom_item_40.description: 3.4 Prevent syslogd from accepting messages from the network
custom_item_40.info: This checks if syslogd -s is turned on, -s hinders syslogd from interacting with the network

custom_item_41.description: 3.5 Disable the email server if possible (sendmail_enable)
custom_item_41.info: This checks if sendmail is set to yes. Sendmail should be off if not necessary

custom_item_42.description: 3.5 Disable the email server if possible (sendmail_submit_enable)
custom_item_42.info: This checks sendmail_submit_enable it is set to yes by default. It should be turned off if sendmail is not necessary

custom_item_43.description: 3.5 Disable the email server if possible (sendmail_outbound_enable)
custom_item_43.info: This checks sendmail_outbound_enable it is set to yes by default. It should be turned off if sendmail is not necessary

custom_item_44.description: 3.5 Disable the email server if possible (sendmail_msp_queue_enable)
custom_item_44.info: This checks sendmail_msp_queue_enable it is set to yes by default. It should be turned off if sendmail is not necessary

custom_item_45.description: 3.6 Only enable BIND if absolutely necessary
custom_item_45.info: This checks if named is enabled. Only enable BIND if necessary

custom_item_46.description: 3.7 Only enable other RPC-based services if absolutely necessary (rpc_lockd_enable)
custom_item_46.info: This checks if rpc lockd service is enabled. Only enable if rpc-based services are necessary

custom_item_47.description: 3.7 Only enable other RPC-based services if absolutely necessary (rpc_statd_enable)
custom_item_47.info: This checks if rpc statd service is enabled. Only enable if rpc-based services are necessary

custom_item_48.description: 3.7 Only enable other RPC-based services if absolutely necessary (rpcbind_enable)
custom_item_48.info: This checks if rpc bind service is enabled. Only enable if rpc-based services are necessary

custom_item_49.description: 3.8 Only enable the NFS server if absolutely necessary (nfs_server_enable)
custom_item_49.info: This checks if nfs server is enabled. Only enable if nfs server is necessary

custom_item_50.description: 3.8 Only enable the NFS server if absolutely necessary (mountd_enable)
custom_item_50.info: This checks if mountd is enabled. Only enable if nfs server is necessary

custom_item_51.description: 3.9 Only enable NFS client processes if absolutely necessary
custom_item_51.info: This checks if nfs client is enabled. Only enable if absolutely necessary

custom_item_52.description: 3.10 Block NFS connections to non-privileged ports
custom_item_52.info: This checks if nfs reserved port only is enabled. It should be set to yes to block nfs connections to non-privileged ports

custom_item_53.info: This checks if weak mountd authentication is enabled. It should be set to no to block non-privileged mountd requests

custom_item_54.description: 3.12 Only enable NIS if absolutely necessary (nis_server_enable)
custom_item_54.info: This checks if nis server is enabled. It should only be enabled if nis is necessary

custom_item_55.description: 3.12 Only enable NIS if absolutely necessary (nis_ypxfrd_enable)
custom_item_55.info: This checks if nis ypxfrd is enabled. It should only be enabled if nis is necessary

custom_item_56.description: 3.12 Only enable NIS if absolutely necessary (nis_yppasswdd_enable)
custom_item_56.info: This checks if nis yppasswdd is enabled. It should only be enabled if nis is necessary

custom_item_57.description: 3.12 Only enable NIS if absolutely necessary (rpc_ypupdated_enable)
custom_item_57.info: This checks if rpc ypupdated is enabled. It should only be enabled if nis is necessary

custom_item_58.description: 3.13 Only enable NIS client daemons if absolutely necessary (nis_client_enable)
custom_item_58.info: This check reports if nis client is enabled. It should only be on if this machine acts as a NIS server for the network

custom_item_59.description: 3.13 Only enable NIS client daemons if absolutely necessary (nis_ypset_enable)
custom_item_59.info: This checks if nis ypset is enabled. It should only be on if this machine acts as a NIS server for the network

custom_item_60.description: 3.14 Only enable the printer daemons if absolutely necessary
custom_item_60.info: This checks if a printer is enabled. If not needed it should be disabled

custom_item_61.info: This checks if core dumps are disabled. Core dumps may contain sensitive data

custom_item_62.info: This check reports if secure level not equal to 1 -warning- modules may not be loaded into a running kernel and may not be able to patch a system without going to single user mode with this setting

custom_item_63.description: 4.3 Block users from viewing unowned processes
custom_item_63.info: This check reports if users can gather info on processes they do not own

custom_item_64.description: 4.4 Block users from viewing processes in other groups
custom_item_64.info: This check reports if users see processes in other groups 4.4

custom_item_65.info: Check for /var/log/debug.log so ftpd and inetd is captured. This is enabled by default

custom_item_67.info: This check reports if accounting is turned on

custom_item_68.description: 5.3 Enable logging of packets received on closed ports (net.inet.tcp.log_in_vain)
custom_item_68.info: This checks logging on closed TCP ports. It should be enabled to log failed connection attempts

custom_item_69.description: 5.3 Enable logging of packets received on closed ports (net.inet.udp.log_in_vain)
custom_item_69.info: This checks logging on closed UDP ports. It should be enabled to log failed connection attempts

custom_item_70.info: The following file should not be world readable and can be chmod to 600

custom_item_71.info: The following file should not be world readable and can be chmod to 600

custom_item_73.info: The following file should not be world readable and can be chmod to 600

custom_item_74.info: The following file should not be world readable and can be chmod to 600

custom_item_75.info: The following file should not be world readable and can be chmod to 600

custom_item_76.description: 5.4 Set permissions on system log files (/var/log/ppp.lo*)
custom_item_76.info: The following file should not be world readable and can be chmod to 600

custom_item_77.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 644 for /var/log/adm.log

custom_item_78.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 644 for /var/log/lpd-errs

custom_item_79.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 644 for /var/log/messages

custom_item_80.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 640 for /var/log/daily.log

custom_item_81.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 640 for /var/log/maillog

custom_item_82.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 640 for /var/log/monthly.log

custom_item_83.description: 5.5 Configure newsyslog for secure file permissions (/var/log/ppp.log)
custom_item_83.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 640 for /var/log/ppp.log

custom_item_84.description: 5.5 Configure newsyslog for secure file permissions (/var/log/sendmail.st)
custom_item_84.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 640 for /var/log/sendmail.st

custom_item_85.description: 5.5 Configure newsyslog for secure file permissions (/var/log/slip.log)
custom_item_85.info: This check will fail if /etc/newsyslog.conf has permissions of 640 for /var/log/slip.log

custom_item_86.info: Check for /etc/periodic.conf to make sure it is there

custom_item_88.info: This check reports if /etc/fstab does not mount cdroms nosuid

custom_item_89.description: 6.2 Verify passwd, master.passwd, and group file permissions (/etc/passwd)

custom_item_90.description: 6.2 Verify passwd, master.passwd, and group file permissions (/etc/group)

custom_item_91.description: 6.2 Verify passwd, master.passwd, and group file permissions (/etc/pwd.db)

custom_item_93.description: 6.2 Verify passwd, master.passwd, and group file permissions (/etc/spwd.db)

custom_item_94.description: 7.1 Remove weak authentication services from PAM (/etc/pam.d/rsh)
custom_item_94.info: This checks if weak authentication is not deactivated in /etc/pam.d/rsh, remove weak authentication from pam

custom_item_95.description: 7.1 Remove weak authentication services from PAM (/etc/pam.d/rexecd)
custom_item_95.info: This checks if weak authentication is not deactivated in /etc/pam.d/rexecd, remove weak authentication from pam

custom_item_98.description: 7.4 Restrict at/cron to authorized users (/etc/crontab permissions)

custom_item_99.description: 7.4 Restrict at/cron to authorized users (/var/cron/allow permissions)
custom_item_99.info: Check if /var/cron/allow exists. Only users in this file are allowed access to the crontab utilities

custom_item_100.description: 7.4 Restrict at/cron to authorized users (/var/at/at.allow permissions)
custom_item_100.info: Check if /var/at/at.allow exists. Only users in this file are allowed access to the at utilities

custom_item_101.description: 7.5 Create warning banners for the system (/etc/motd)
custom_item_101.info: This checks if Authorized Use Only is in /etc/motd, warning #messages assist in prosecution

custom_item_102.description: 7.5 Create warning banners for the system (/etc/motd permissions)

custom_item_103.description: 7.6 Remove the X wrapper and enable xdm
custom_item_103.info: This checks if xdm is enabled in /etc/ttys -warning- if you do enable it then delete wrapper pkg also -warning- if /usr/X11R6/bin/xdm does not exist - do not turn on

custom_item_104.description: 7.7 Prevent xdm from listening on port 6000/TCP
custom_item_104.info: Check if X11 server is installed. If it is, disable xdm ability to accept connections on port 6000

custom_item_105.info: This check will fail if uucp is not set to /sbin/nologin -warning- should not be set if uucp is used

custom_item_106.description: 8.2 Verify that accounts either have a password or are disabled
custom_item_106.info: Verify That There Are No Accounts With Empty Password Fields

custom_item_107.description: 8.3 Set account expiration parameters on all active user accounts
custom_item_107.info: This will check /etc/login.conf for maxpassword age (checks for 91 days or less)

custom_item_108.info: This will check /etc/adduser.conf for upwexpire=91d or less

custom_item_109.description: 8.7 No user dot-files should be world writable
custom_item_109.info: Check for group or world-writeable dotfiles in home directory

custom_item_110.info: This checks /etc/login.conf for umask 22. It should be set to 077

custom_item_111.info: This checks /etc/profile for umask 22. It should be set to 077

custom_item_112.info: This checks /etc/csh.login for umask 22. It should be set to 077

custom_item_113.info: This checks /etc/csh.cshrc for umask 22. It should be set to 077

custom_item_114.info: This checks /usr/share/skel/dot.cshrc for umask 22. It should be set to 077

custom_item_115.info: This checks /usr/share/skel/dot.shrc for umask 22. It should be set to 077

custom_item_116.description: 8.9 Set 'mesg n' as the default for all users (/etc/profile)
custom_item_116.info: This checks if mesg n is set in /etc/profile to strengthen tty. Setting to 'n' will block users from the write or talk utilities

custom_item_117.description: 8.9 Set 'mesg n' as the default for all users (/etc/csh.login)
custom_item_117.info: This checks if mesg n is set in /etc/csh.login to strengthen tty. Setting to 'n' will block users from the write or talk utilities

custom_item_118.description: 8.10 Use Blowfish encryption for all users by default
custom_item_118.info: This checks if Blowfish is the default encryption algorithm
